data.title: Begin Machine Learning By Finding The Landmarks
data.description: Where do you begin in machine learning? Is actually breaking ground and getting started a question of motivation? In this post discover the personal story of how finding the landmarks in machine learning made the difference for one software engineer. I received an inspiring email from Cliff Bryant in the new year. Cliff is a senior software engineer looking […]

data.title: How To Use R For Machine Learning
data.description: There are a ton of packages for R. Which ones are best to use for your machine learning project? In this post you will discover the exact R functions and packages recommended for each sub task in a machine learning journey. This is useful. Bookmark this page. I’m sure you will be checking back time […]

data.title: Use R For Machine Learning
data.description: You should use R for machine learning. R is one of the most powerful machine learning platforms and is used by the top data scientists in the world. In this post you will learn why you should use R for machine learning. Let’s get started. Why You Should Care About R R is used by […]

data.title: Why Implement a Machine Learning Algorithm From Scratch
data.description: Why would you ever implement machine learning algorithms from scratch when there are so many provided in existing APIs? This is a great question. One that must be considered before you write that first line of code. In this post you will discover a variety of interesting and even thought-provoking answers to this question. The […]

data.title: Extend Machine Learning Tools and Demonstrate Mastery
data.description: After you have been using a tool for a while, you will develop a specific way of working with it. You may even have deep knowledge of the limitations of the tool and how to fix them, or be frustrated by specific features that are missing. You can augment machine learning tools to formalize the […]

data.title: Build a Deep Understanding of Machine Learning Tools Using Small Targeted Projects
data.description: Once you have chosen a machine learning tool you need to improve your skill in using it. Machine learning tools have a large number of features. Having a recipe for using a feature is not the same as deeply knowing how to use the feature, its limitations or its capabilities. Also, once you build skills […]

data.title: Jump-Start Using Any Machine Learning Tool With Recipes
data.description: How do you best use a machine learning tool to make accurate predictions? You select and use machine learning tools only to make your life easier on a machine learning project. The tools are exist to help you build models that make accurate predictions. It is important that you know how to best use them […]

data.title: Understand Any Machine Learning Tool Quickly (even if you are a beginner)
data.description: How can you learn about a machine learning tool quickly? Using the right tool can mean the difference between getting good predictions quickly and a project on which you cannot deliver. You need to evaluate machine learning tools before you use them. You need to know that a machine learning tool is right for you, right […]

data.title: Map the Landscape of Machine Learning Tools
data.description: There are a lot of machine learning tools out there. Which ones should you use? What tools could actually be useful on your project? Choosing a tool is a big deal. The tools that you use for machine learning determine the results you can achieve. It is critical that you take the time to choose […]

data.title: How To Learn Any Machine Learning Tool
data.description: Machine learning tools save you time by automating aspects of a machine learning project. There are platforms that you can use to work through a machine learning project end-to-end. There are also libraries that provide capabilities for one piece of a machine learning project. Using the right machine learning tools is as important as using the right machine learning algorithms. But […]

data.title: Machine Learning Tools
data.description: Tools are a big part of machine learning and choosing the right tool can be as important as working with the best algorithms. In this post you will take a closer look at machine learning tools. Discover why they are important and the types of tools that you could choose from. Why Use Tools Machine learning tools […]

data.title: Basic Concepts in Machine Learning
data.description: What are the basic concepts in machine learning? I found that the best way to discover and get a handle on the basic concepts in machine learning is to review the introduction chapters to machine learning textbooks and to watch the videos from the first model in online courses. Pedro Domingos is a lecturer and professor on machine […]

data.title: Useful Things To Know About Machine Learning
data.description: Do you want some tips and tricks that are useful in developing successful machine learning applications? This is the subject of a journal article from 2012 titled “A Few Useful Things to Know about Machine Learning” (PDF) by University of Washing professor Pedro Domingos. It’s an in interesting read with a great opening hook: developing successful machine […]

data.title: Tour of Real-World Machine Learning Problems
data.description: Real-world examples make the abstract description of machine learning become concrete. In this post you will go on a tour of real world machine learning problems. You will see how machine learning can actually be used in fields like education, science, technology and medicine. Each machine learning problem listed also includes a link to the publicly available […]

data.title: Interview: How a Beginner Used Small Projects To Get Started in Machine Learning
data.description: It is valuable to get insight into how real people are getting started in machine learning. In this post you will discover how a beginner (just like you) got started and is making great progress in applying machine learning. I find interviews like this absolutely fascinating because of all of the things you can learn. […]

data.title: Philosophy Graduate to Machine Learning Practitioner (an interview with Brian Thomas)
data.description: Getting started in machine learning can be frustrating. There’s so much to learn that it feels overwhelming. So much so that many developers interested in machine learning never get started. The idea of creating models on ad hoc datasets and entering a Kaggle competition sounds exciting a far off goal. So how did a Philosophy graduate get started in machine learning? […]

data.title: How Do I Get Started In Machine Learning? (the short version)
data.description: In this post I give my no-BS approach for getting started in machine learning. It's simple that you will have no excuses to not get started.

data.title: Gentle Introduction to Predictive Modeling
data.description: When you're an absolute beginner it can be very confusion. In this post I want to give a gentle introduction to predictive modeling.

data.title: How to Use a Machine Learning Checklist to Get Accurate Predictions, Reliably
data.description: Discover a checklist that you can use to reliably get accurate predictions on your machine learning problems, even if you're a beginner.

data.title: Data Science From Scratch: Book Review
data.description: We take a closer look at the book Data Science from Scratch. If you want to get intimate with machine learning algorithms, then this book is for you.

data.title: Find Your Machine Learning Tribe
data.description: Avoid getting the wrong advice. Find your machine learning tribe and use the best resources for getting started and making progress in machine learning.

data.title: Understand Machine Learning Algorithms By Implementing Them From Scratch
data.description: Implementing machine learning algorithms from scratch seems like a great way for a programmer to understand machine learning. And maybe it is. But there some downsides to this approach too. In this post you will discover some great resources that you can use to implement machine learning algorithms from scratch. You will also discover some of […]

data.title: Choosing Machine Learning Algorithms: Lessons from Microsoft Azure
data.description: Microsoft recently launched support for machine learning in their Azure cloud computing platform. Buried in some of their technical documentation for the platform are some resources that you may find useful for thinking about what machine learning algorithm to use in different situations. In this post we take a look at the Microsoft recommendations for […]

data.title: 5 Ways To Understand Machine Learning Algorithms (without math)
data.description: Where does theory fit into a top-down approach to studying machine learning? In the traditional approach to teaching machine learning, theory comes first requiring an extensive background in mathematics to be able to understand it. In my approach to teaching machine learning, I start with teaching you how to work problems end-to-end and deliver results. […]

data.title: Practice Machine Learning with Datasets from the UCI Machine Learning Repository
data.description: Where can you get good datasets to practice machine learning? Datasets that are real-world so that they are interesting and relevant, although small enough for you to review in Excel and work through on your desktop. In this post you will discover a database of high-quality, real-world, and well understood machine learning datasets that you […]

data.title: 8 Tactics to Combat Imbalanced Classes in Your Machine Learning Dataset
data.description: Has this happened to you? You are working on your dataset. You create a classification model and get 90% accuracy immediately. “Fantastic” you think. You dive a little deeper and discover that 90% of the data belongs to one class. Damn! This is an example of an imbalanced dataset and the frustrating results it can […]

data.title: Machine Learning for Developers
data.description: How Do I Get Started In Machine Learning? I’m a developer. I have read a book or some posts on machine learning. I have watched some of the Coursera machine learning course. I still don’t know how to get started… Does this sound familiar? The most common question I’m asked by developers on my newsletter is: How do […]

data.title: Get Paid To Apply Machine Learning
data.description: The Ladder Approach That You Can Use To Become a Machine Learning Consultant Do you want to do machine learning and get paid for it? Be careful what you wish for. In this post I outline a blueprint that you can use to learn enough machine learning to help small businesses and start-ups with their […]

data.title: Get Started and Make Progress in Machine Learning
data.description: In this post I layout my manifesto for how you can get started and make progress in machine learning. In this post you will discover what machine learning is, why it matters, how to do it and how to identify and overcome your self-limiting beliefs. Why Get Started in Machine Learning I believe machine learning is an important […]

data.title: What To Do During Machine Learning Model Runs
data.description: There was a recent question that asked “How to not waste-time/procrastinate while ml scripts are running?“. I think this is an important question. I think answers to this question show a level of organization or maturity in your approach to work. I left a small comment on this question, but in this post I elaborate […]
